note.p: Birth: 62 Rodney Street, Liverpool, Lancashire, England (29 December 1809)
Education: Eton; Christ Church, Oxford. BA (1831, Double First)

Career: Secretary of State for the Colonies (1845); Chancellor of the Exchequer (1852, 1859, 1880-1882); MP for Newark (1832-1845); MP for the University of Oxford (1847-1865); MP for South Lancashire (1865-1868); MP for Greenwich (1868-1880); Prime Minister (1868-1874, 1880-1885, 1886 and 1892-1894); MP for Midlothian (1880-1895); given a public funeral
References: Vanity Fair 06 February 1869, 05 November 1887, 26 May 1898
Sir John Craig, 'The Royal Society and the Royal Mint' in NR 1964 vol 19 pp 156-167
Notes: Certificate printed: Certificate of a candidate of the privileged class for Election
